item.title: 美国 10 月份职位空缺小幅增加
item.description: 美国 10 月份的职位空缺略有增加，但由于雇主们在不确定的经济环境中艰难前行，招聘工作依然低迷。【原文：U.S. job openings increased marginally in October, but hiring remained subdued as employers navigated an uncertain economic environment.】

item.title: 联合利华首席执行官表示，联合利华每年拨款 17 亿美元用于并购，重点是美国市场
item.description: 联合利华首席执行官费尔南多-费尔南德斯（Fernando Fernandez）周二表示，联合利华每年将拨出约 15 亿欧元（17.4 亿美元）用于并购，重点是在美国的交易。【原文：Unilever is allocating about 1.5 billion euros ($1.74 billion) a year for mergers and acquisitions, focusing heavily on deals in the United States, CEO Fernando Fernandez said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Spotify 向美国和加拿大的高级用户扩展音乐视频访问权限，以对抗 YouTube
item.description: Spotify 周二表示，将向美国和加拿大的高级订户提供音乐视频，这家瑞典流媒体巨头将在市场份额上向 YouTube 发起挑战。【原文：Spotify said on Tuesday it is making music videos available to premium subscribers in the U.S. and Canada, as the Swedish streaming giant challenges YouTube for market share.】

item.title: 独家报道：维基百科运营商任命前美国驻智利大使为首席执行官
item.description: 维基百科运营商维基媒体基金会周二任命伯纳黛特-米汉（Bernadette Meehan）为首席执行官，选拔一位具有深厚政策专业知识和联邦政府工作经验的管理者来领导这本在线百科全书。【原文：Wikimedia Foundation, the operator of Wikipedia, on Tuesday named Bernadette Meehan its chief executive officer, tapping an administrator with deep policy expertise and federal government experience to lead the online encyclopedia.】

item.title: 美国运输部称，因 A320 软件更新而中断航班的乘客无权获得航空公司赔偿
item.description: 美国运输部周二表示，上个月因政府紧急指令更新空客A320飞机软件而延误或取消美国航班的航空公司无需为受影响的乘客提供酒店、餐饮或其他福利。【原文：Airlines that delayed or cancelled U.S. flights last month due to an emergency government directive to update the software on Airbus A320 planes were not required to provide hotels, meals or other benefits to impacted passengers, the U.S. Transportation Department said Tuesday.】

item.title: 意大利制定个人数据保护苛刻条款，为中国 JD.com 收购 Ceconomy 案扫清障碍
item.description: 路透社周二看到的一份政府法令显示，意大利在个人数据保护方面制定了严格的条款，以批准中国电子商务巨头京东商城对德国电子产品零售商 Ceconomy 的收购。【原文：Italy has set tough terms on personal data protection to clear Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's takeover of German electronics retailer Ceconomy , a government decree seen by Reuters showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 埃森哲与 Anthropic 建立多年合作关系，促进人工智能的应用
item.description: 埃森哲和 Anthropic 周二宣布通过一个新的业务集团扩大双方的合作关系，该咨询巨头的约 30,000 名员工将接受这家人工智能初创公司 Claude 模型的培训。【原文：Accenture and Anthropic on Tuesday announced an expansion of their partnership through a new business group where around 30,000 of the consulting giant's employees will be trained on the AI startup's Claude model.】

item.title: 亨德里克斯经典专辑在与索尼的英国版权争夺战中备受瞩目
item.description: 吉米-亨德里克斯（Jimi Hendrix）20 世纪 60 年代的经典专辑成为伦敦一起表演者权利诉讼的焦点，索尼音乐娱乐公司（Sony Music Entertainment）代表吉米-亨德里克斯的英国贝斯手和鼓手对该公司提起诉讼，索尼音乐娱乐公司警告说，如果索赔人胜诉，可能会 "使音乐产业陷入混乱"。【原文：Jimi Hendrix's classic 1960s albums are the focus of a London lawsuit over performers' rights asserted on behalf of his British bassist and drummer against Sony Music Entertainment , which warns that a win for the claimants could "throw the music industry into chaos".】

item.title: 身份安全公司 Saviynt 在最新一轮融资中估值约 30 亿美元
item.description: 身份安全公司 Saviynt 周二表示，在美国投资公司 KKR 领投的一轮融资中，该公司的估值约为 30 亿美元。【原文：Identity-security company Saviynt said on Tuesday it was valued at about $3 billion in a funding round led by U.S. investment firm KKR , amid companies bolstering their security tools in the face of rising AI-driven threats.】

item.title: 富国银行预计 2026 年将裁员更多
item.description: 富国银行首席执行官查理-沙尔夫（Charlie Scharf）周二表示，富国银行预计明年员工人数将减少，并预计第四季度的遣散费用将增加。【原文：Wells Fargo expects its headcount to decline next year and anticipates higher severance costs in the current fourth quarter, CEO Charlie Scharf said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Reliance-Disney's JioHotstar to invest $444 million in south Indian content, executive says
item.description: India's JioHotstar plans to invest $444 million over five years to acquire and produce content from south India, an executive said on Monday, as the Walt Disney and Reliance Industries-owned streaming platform seeks to capitalize on growing demand for regional cinema.

item.title: Trafigura lifts dividend payments in 2025 despite lower net profits
item.description: Global commodities trading house Trafigura raised its dividends by 50% to almost $3 billion in 2025, despite a small drop in net profit after a second consecutive year of high impairments.

item.title: Microsoft to invest $17.5 billion in India, CEO Nadella says
item.description: Microsoft will invest $17.5 billion in India, its chief executive Satya Nadella said on social media platform X on Tuesday, as global behemoths race to build infrastructure in one the world's fastest growing digital markets.

item.title: Australia social media ban takes effect in world first
item.description: Australia at midnight (1300 GMT) on Wednesday became the first country in the world to ban social media for children under 16, blocking them from platforms including TikTok, Alphabet's YouTube and Meta's Instagram and Facebook.

item.title: How China's AI chips stack up against Nvidia's H200
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said the United States would allow Nvidia's H200 processors to be exported to China, though it remains unclear whether Beijing will give the green light to Chinese companies to purchase them.

item.title: 家得宝 2026 财年销售额和利润均低于预期
item.description: 家居装饰连锁店家得宝（Home Depot）周二预计，由于对 DIY 项目和大件商品的需求降温，2026 财年的可比销售额增长和利润将低于分析师的预期。【原文：Home improvement chain Home Depot on Tuesday forecast fiscal 2026 comparable sales growth and profit below analysts' estimates as demand for do-it-yourself projects and big-ticket items cools.】

item.title: 包装食品需求回升，金宝莱销售额超出预期
item.description: 金宝汤公司（Campbell's Co）周二公布的第一季度销售额超过了华尔街的预期，这主要得益于罐装汤和即食餐需求的恢复性增长，因为在经济不确定的情况下，消费者选择在家里吃得更多。【原文：Campbell's Co beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter sales on Tuesday, helped by resilient demand for its canned soups and ready-to-eat meals as consumers opt to eat more at home amid economic uncertainty.】

item.title: EssilorLuxottica 董事称 Meta 持有雷朋制造商 "至少 3%" 的股份
item.description: 雷朋（Ray-Ban）眼镜背后的欧洲公司董事会董事周二表示，Facebook 的所有者 Meta 至少持有 EssilorLuxottica 3% 的股份。【原文：Facebook-owner Meta holds at least a 3% stake in EssilorLuxottica , a board director at the European firm behind Ray-Ban glasses said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 埃克森公司预测到 2030 年盈利将有更高增长
item.description: 美国最大的石油生产商埃克森美孚周二将其 2024 年至 2030 年的盈利增长预期上调至 250 亿美元，现金流增长预期上调至 350 亿美元。【原文：Top U.S. oil producer Exxon Mobil on Tuesday raised its earnings growth outlook to $25 billion and cash flow growth to $35 billion from 2024 to 2030.】

item.title: 美国银行称，2026 年美国私人信贷违约将有所缓解，但脆弱性将持续存在
item.description: 美银全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）的策略师表示，随着利率下降，私人信贷违约率明年将走低，但他们警告说，这个炙手可热的行业仍然是美国信贷市场最脆弱的部分之一。【原文：Private credit defaults are set to edge lower next year as interest rates drop, strategists at BofA Global Research said, but warned that the red-hot sector remains among the most fragile parts of the U.S. credit market.】

item.title: 特朗普称支持降息是对美联储主席提名人的关键考验
item.description: 据周二发表的 Politico 采访报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，支持立即降息将是他选择领导美联储的任何人的一项要求。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said support for immediately cutting interest rates would be a requirement for anyone he chose to lead the Federal Reserve, according to a Politico interview published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价美联储会议召开之际，摇摆不定的债券找到了平衡点
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 美联储降息决定临近，华尔街开盘低迷
item.description: 由于投资者在等待美联储的政策决定，华尔街主要股指在周二开盘时表现低迷，而英伟达（Nvidia）股价则因有关向中国出口先进人工智能芯片的反差消息而受到冲击。【原文：Wall Street's main stock indexes were subdued at the open on Tuesday as investors awaited the Federal Reserve's policy decision, while Nvidia shares were whipsawed by contrasting news around exports of advanced AI chips to China.】

item.title: 微软未来两年将在加拿大投资 50 多亿美元
item.description: 微软周二表示，未来两年将在加拿大投资超过 75 亿加元（54.2 亿美元），因为这家科技巨头正专注于建立云计算和人工智能基础设施。【原文：Microsoft said on Tuesday it is investing more than C$7.5 billion ($5.42 billion) in Canada over the next two year, as the tech giant focuses on building out its cloud and AI infrastructure footprint.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，欧洲央行支持更简单而非更宽松的银行规则
item.description: 两位熟悉欧洲央行提案的消息人士告诉路透社，欧洲央行将提议简化银行资本缓冲要求的规则，修剪全球金融危机后实施的一些复杂监管措施。【原文：The European Central Bank will propose simplifying rules on capital buffers required of banks, pruning some of the complex regulation put in place after the global financial crisis, two sources familiar with the proposals told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家报道智利监管机构和工人指出泰克布兰卡大坝存在风险
item.description: 据路透社查阅的文件显示，智利当局在 8 月份对泰克的旗舰矿山 Quebrada Blanca 铜矿出现大裂缝和泄漏表示担忧，并批评该矿商没有立即报告这些问题。【原文：Chilean authorities in August raised concerns over a large crack and leaks at Teck's flagship Quebrada Blanca copper mine and criticized the miner for not immediately reporting the issues, according to documents reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 鲍威尔任期结束，美联储面临动荡的 2026 年，独立性面临考验
item.description: 本周是美国联邦储备委员会今年的最后一次会议，在此之前的 2026 年将是动荡的一年，届时将出现关键的决策者变动，包括由唐纳德-特朗普总统任命的新领导人的上任，以及在法律和政治压力下对其独立性的考验。【原文：The final U.S. Federal Reserve meeting of the year this week precedes a turbulent 2026 that will see key policymaker changes, including the arrival of a new leader to be named by President Donald Trump, and tests of its independence amid legal and political pressure.】

item.title: 独家报道美国食品和药物管理局对已获批准的婴儿 RSV 疗法进行新的安全性审查
item.description: 多位熟悉情况的消息人士告诉路透社，美国卫生监管机构上周通知默克、赛诺菲和阿斯利康公司的高级管理人员，在疫苗怀疑论者提出担忧后，这些公司已获批准的婴儿 RSV 保护性疗法将接受新的安全性审查。【原文：U.S. health regulators informed senior executives at Merck, Sanofi and AstraZeneca last week that their approved protective RSV treatments for infants would be subject to fresh safety scrutiny following concerns raised by vaccine skeptics, multiple sources familiar with the situation told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，美国银行提出通过出售卢克石油公司资产偿还美国投资者的计划
item.description: 消息人士称，美国投资银行 Xtellus Partners 已向美国财政部提议，将出售卢克石油公司海外资产的收益用于偿还因俄罗斯乌克兰战争而冻结其持有的卢克石油公司股票而蒙受损失的美国投资者。【原文：U.S. investment bank Xtellus Partners has proposed to the U.S. Treasury that proceeds from the sale of Lukoil's foreign assets be used to repay American investors who lost money when Russia's war in Ukraine froze their Lukoil stock holdings, sources said.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：尽管特朗普批准了英伟达 H200 芯片的出口，但中国仍将限制其进入中国市场
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周二援引两位知情人士的话报道称，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普决定允许向中国出口英伟达（Nvidia）先进的H200芯片，但中国政府仍将限制该芯片的使用。【原文：Beijing is set to limit access to Nvidia's advanced H200 chips despite U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to allow the export of the technology to China, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing two people with knowledge of the matter.】
